description:
GP Strategies Corporation is one of the world's leading talent transformation providers. By delivering award-winning learning and development solutions, we help organizations transform through their people and achieve meaningful change. GP Strategies has delivered our innovative consulting, learning services, and talent technology solutions to over 6,000 organizations globally.

From our global experience working across thousands of projects and initiatives over the past 55 years, we've learned that relationships, business, work, innovation, strategy, and transformation are all about people. And, to put it simply, GP Strategies is about our people - an extensive global network of learning experts. Additional information can be found at www.gpstrategies.com.

Summary

To provide a new business sales leadership for the organization through the development of existing and new relationships. This is a senior level position engaged in the development and implementation of business development strategies and initiatives.

I

n relation to this specific role:
• Grow regional/global network with Chief Learning and Talent Executives.
• Grow Managed Learning Services opportunity pipeline in partnership with the Senior Vice President of MLS Sales, Corporate Marketing, and in support of Americas MLS Operations.
• Achieve Sales Targets as agreed with the SVP of MLS Sales.
• Provide sales, account management and new business development skills to the organization, allowing it to grow business through capture of new clients and to develop opportunities to expand within existing clients.
• Collaborate with Sales and Operational teams from different business units across region.
• Execute sales development plans and participate in sales and marketing campaigns.
• Plan, organize, write and edit sales proposals.
• Plan, develop and/or participate in client sales pitches and presentations.
• Take the necessary steps to identify client needs and translate those into solutions that meet or exceed sales related targets and objectives.
• Evaluate the risk of decisions, actions and proposals as compared to the potential opportunity. Make commitments only within allowable limits and engage capture teams in the analysis and decision-making processes when individual experience is limited or insufficient for the purpose.
• Qualifications
• 10+ years of successful sales experience and business development experience.
• Professional qualification/Degree or equivalent experience.
• Direct experience in Managed Learning Services and execution of learning solutions.
• Advanced communication and networking skills.
• Experience working with Global Clients.
• Recognized training and management experience.
• Experience or knowledge of selling learning products and services.
• Experienced in developing collaborative and creative solutions.
• Valid current passport for international travel.
• Eligibility to work in the United States without sponsorship is required.

With more than 4000 employees in over 30 countries, diversity at GP Strategies is second nature! Beyond our locations, our culture focuses on performance and revolves around respect, fairness, and working collaboratively to achieve our goals. We support our People, no matter who they are or where they are from, because we all have valuable and unique perspectives and approaches. That's how great ideas are born, which enable us to work smarter.

GP Strategies is committed and proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related conditions, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other federally protected class.
